Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2012 12:36PM TKSit wrote: The radiologist should be able to give you complete results on the mammo. You will have a very good idea if there is any cancer present at that time or if a biopsy is indicated. The ultrasound is a great addition to help in diagnosing any abnormalities. Was there any earlier appts available for a mammo this week? Hate to have you wait, esp thru weekend. Call clinic and push for sooner appt if you can. There are ways to get in sooner. Good luck! Keep us posted.

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2012 07:59PM TKSit wrote: Not sure why your doc is using that terminology? My advice would be to get in sooner for a mammogram. I had a "thickening", by my own discription, which is what prompted me to get a mammo. Sad to say, my mammo did show bc. I don't want to alarm you, but try to get in sooner for mammo. If there is something to be concerned about a radiologist may give you results that day. Every imaging clinic is different, so I only have my experience to go by. Sending a prayer your way, good luck & keep us posted!

Posts.Title: Courage effcancer effcancer

Posts.Content: TKSit wrote: Just reading thru the stage VI threads and a bizzare feeling came over me tonight. Am I really one of these ladies? Do I have so much in common with them. I am back to feeling "normal", healthier, did I really even have cancer? I am at a strange place right now. Excited to make plans for the future, but how far in future? Disneyworld next year would work, but what about visiting colleges for daughter later in year? Will I be sick, healthy, in hospital or mentally incapable to do anything. Sorry to ramble, but just feeling thoughtful tonight. Do I really have and Will always have cancer? Maybe not. You don't have a soul. You are a soul. You have a body. Dx 1/2/2011, IDC, 5cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Aug 19, 2012 08:44PM TKSit wrote: I am a Christian and even I get a bit uncomfortable when people say they are praying for me. It is because I hate this disease and, therefore, hate that I have to be prayed for. Messed up, huh? Although, I do realize that people are truly concerned and do wish for me to heal. That in itself does lift my spirits and keeps me positive. I agree, very touchy subject, as people are passionate about their beliefs or non-beliefs. But really, what do you have to lose if people want to pray for you? Unless your name is being announced in public, I get that.

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2012 10:48PM TKSit wrote: Very thought provoking thread. I had bmx Jan 2011. I look in the mirror & with all my surgeries (mast, hyster, c-sec & more) I have about 3 feet of scars on my trunk. But scars are better than cancer & my c-sec resulted in a beautiful daughter. My hubby is very supportive, but my hands still go up to cover my scars if he catches me naked. I know he loves me deeply and still wants to show me in a physical manner. I still feel like I look attractive, just not sexy. A quote I remember often is, "God does not look us over for medals, degrees or awards, but for scars."

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2012 09:29PM TKSit wrote: Reading this thread I am amazed at all the wonderful advice there is from some very tough and special women. This subject brings me the most pain and I really don't let my mind "go there", for fear of not being able to pull it back together. The thought of not being here for my girls is too much to bear. What I have done that helps is, started a journal book for each of them. I titled them "You, Me and Us". I put stories about my childhood, my funny memories, crazy times as a teen, ect in "me" part of journal. In the "you" part I have the story of my pregnancy with them, their birth story, really everything I can remember from their childhood. Even just the small stuff, like favorite book, names of fav toys or all halloween costums. Then in the "us" part I write about special times spent together on vacations, visiting pumpkin patch in Fall, first manicure together, decorating xmas tree, anything that I can remember that was special family times. Months ago I thought, Damit if I am gone, these sweet girls should still get to know what precious times we had, they need to know all the info that ONLY a mother would know about their lives. Why should they have to miss out on the memories of their mama? I am not going to let that happen. Cancer may take my body from them, but I will be damned that it takes our memories with it. You would think it would be sad writting all this in my daughter's books, I did. But it brings me such joy going back in time and remembering what a blessed life I have had. What started out as a gift to give my girls after I am gone, has turned into a gift for me. A gift of remembering a life with these 2 beautiful girls. A gift of knowing that I have got everything I had ever prayed for. I feel so happy when I am done writing, the best therapy for me. Different memories come to me that I have't thought about in years and I just smile and am pumped that my girls will get to read it. I am full of hope that I will fill that book with many memories to come. Prayers to all you mother's struggling with this dispair.

Posts.Content: TKSit wrote: I saw my onco today for my 3 month visit and he suggested not scheduling a PET scan in 3 months? This make me very nervous! He is concerned about the radiation exposure, which I understand, I just don't want to miss a recurrence. Onco said that if my labs looked funky or if I had any suspicious symptoms, he would be glad to schedule one at my visit in 3 months. My PET scans have been NED for 4 years (I have them every 6 months), I am in good health otherwise, with no aches or pains. Any thoughts? Thank you! You don't have a soul. You are a soul.
